Description: Magical gem; intaglio; dark green jasper; engraved on side A. Side A: Harpocrates sitting to right on lotus with knees drawn up. A snake is coiling around the lotus stalk; under the flower two smaller stalks with buds. Baseline indicating primeval mound? Horus’ left hand raised to his mouth, his right holds a flail. A long side-lock of youth is falling to his neck, on the top of his head the double crown of Egypt. Side B: Inscribed in two lines.
Bibliographic references: Michel 2001 / Die Magischen Gemmen im Britischen Museum (111)
Bonner 1950 / Studies in magical amulets, chiefly Graeco-Egyptian
CBd / The Campbell Bonner Magical Gems Database Online (511) (http://classics.mfab.hu/talismans/cbd/511)
